thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: Brockton star running back Kerry Raymond out for the year with a knee injury | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: Brockton star running back Kerry Raymond out for the year with a knee injury | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: Brockton star running back Kerry Raymond out for the year with a knee injury | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
Kerry Raymond's first appearance proved to be his last.
 The Brockton running back suffered a season-ending knee injury late in last week's 20-14 victory over Catholic Memorial. According to sources within the program, Raymond suffered a torn right ACL inury and will undergo surgery.
 After missing the first two games with an injury, Raymond returned to the lineup last Friday and rushed for 135 yards and a touchdown on 18 carries. With Raymond out, Jose Monteiro Jr. and Dominic Simpson will be expected to shoulder much of the offensive load.
